issue.title: [C++] Acero should reject Substrait plans that require an implicit cast from decimal to float
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-18193](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-18193). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
There are a number of functions that Acero currently implements for decimal types by first casting to float implicitly.  Substrait does not allow for this kind of implicit cast.  If a plan does not have a decimal-native implementation of a function then it should reject the plan.
